snippet: Federal prisons fail in their duty to allow early release of terminally ill and aged inmates.
abstract: Editorial cites Justice Dept report detailing failure of Federal Bureau of Prisons to do its duty in  release of terminally ill inmates and others in extreme situations; holds it is time for Congress to conduct hearing that puts department and bureau on public record about what they are doing to fulfill their duty under the law and to hold them accountable.
lead_paragraph: Federal prisons fail in their duty to allow early release of terminally ill and aged inmates.
